com.samsung.android.sdk.healthdata

Interface HealthConstants.DiscreteMeasurement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HealthConstants.Common
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HealthConstants.AmbientTemperature, HealthConstants.BloodGlucose, HealthConstants.BloodPressure, HealthConstants.BodyTemperature, HealthConstants.CaffeineIntake, HealthConstants.FoodIntake, HealthConstants.HbA1c, HealthConstants.UvExposure, HealthConstants.WaterIntake, HealthConstants.Weight
    Enclosing class:
    HealthConstants

    public static interface HealthConstants.DiscreteMeasurement
extends HealthConstants.Common
    This interface contains basic constants for measurement such as the start or offset time.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String START_TIME
      UTC Time in milliseconds when the measurement is started.
      static String TIME_OFFSET
      Time offset in milliseconds which considers time zone and daylight saving time.

      • Fields inherited from interface com.samsung.android.sdk.healthdata.HealthConstants.Common

        CREATE_TIME, DEVICE_UUID, PACKAGE_NAME, UPDATE_TIME, UUID

    • Field Detail

      • START_TIME

        static final String START_TIME
        UTC Time in milliseconds when the measurement is started.
        TIME_OFFSET needs to set for showing data's measured time properly according to user's location.

        • Mandatory
        • Type: long
        • Value range: 0 and above

        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TIME_OFFSET

        static final String TIME_OFFSET
        Time offset in milliseconds which considers time zone and daylight saving time. E.g. Tehran (UTC+3:30) is presented as 12600000 (3.5 * 60 * 60 * 1000).
        It affects to START_TIME to show measured time properly to user.

        • Mandatory
        • Type: long
        • Value range: -43200000 (-12 * 60 * 60 * 1000) ~ 50400000 (14 * 60 * 60 * 1000)

        Refer to the following example for getting the time offset value as the current device's preferred time zone and daylight is not used. 

           public class HeathDataExample {

     long getTimeOffset(long currentTime) {
         return TimeZone.getDefault().getOffset(currentTime);
     }
 }

        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
